fixes.name: Profit Margin %
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the dependent Tableau calculated field [Profit Margin %] which is [Profit Ratio ]*100 into a row-level DAX calculated column by multiplying the row-level field 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] by 100.

fixes.name: Revenue Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] > 1000,
    "High Margin",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10,
        "Medium Margin",
        "Low Margin"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau IF / ELSEIF / ELSE logic into nested DAX IF statements using row-level columns: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] and the calculated column 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %]. This is a row-level classification, so it is a calculated column.
